title: Your first peek behind the scenes of the new ‘Will & Grace’ reboot
text:
This just in: The Will and Grace reboot has officially begun filming and the cast is having a gay old time! 
The sitcom originally ran for eight seasons from 1998 until 2006. During last year’s presidential campaign, they reunited for a hilarious one-off election skit , which sparked rumors of a possible series comeback. Then in January, NBC announced the network had ordered 10 new episodes , which will air later this year. 
Well, last weekend, they started doing promo shots and gearing up for production, and lucky for us, the cast shared plenty of behind-the-scenes updates…. 
Megan Mullally says she’s “back in drag” and ready to raise hell alongside her GBF Sean Hayes: back in drag #willandgrace pic.twitter.com/5RCKr0rJb9 
— Megan Mullally (@MeganOMullally) March 5, 2017 
promo shoot secrets #willandgrace @SeanHayes pic.twitter.com/1Wm7UN45tl 
— Megan Mullally (@MeganOMullally) March 4, 2017 

Eric McCormack shared this group selfie of the gang: Spent the last 3 days with these loons & boy, are my arms tired. @DebraMessing @SeanHayes @MeganOMullally #Will &Grace pic.twitter.com/FwioowjXdg 
— Eric McCormack (@EricMcCormack) March 5, 2017 

Sean Hayes posted a shot of the crew in action: Just like riding a bike. ? @MeganOMullally @DebraMessing @EricMcCormack #WillAndGrace pic.twitter.com/OmpKwNJrlP 
— Sean Hayes (@SeanHayes) March 5, 2017 

And Debra Messing took a break from her usual tweeting about the doom-and-gloom of politics to share her excitement with being reunited with her old co-workers: Yeah, this weekend was a little fun. Just a little. #thegang #reunited &itfeelssogood… https://t.co/7DobYSeYpD 
— Debra Messing (@DebraMessing) March 6, 2017 

Feeling nostalgic yet?
